poem:
"Call to Collectors"

For original works by Cook,
Beryl's delights, corners of Britain,
Flavors of life on canvas, sought.

Bring forth her art,
scattered across eclectic hearts,
to a dwelling unified in a gallery gasp.  

In tango with Finnish beats,
Tom of Finland, a vibrant feast,
Entwined in a dance,
this exhibition of chance,
Awakens the global appetite for a visual feast.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Gallery issues plea to collectors to loan original Beryl Cook works for exhibition A leading gallery has issued a public plea to art collectors for help in recovering original works by Beryl Cook – one of Britain’s best-loved painters – so they can be included in a new exhibition. The show will bring together the world of Cook and Finnish artist Tom of Finland – real name Touko Valio Laaksonen – for the first time,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.

The show will bring together the world of Cook and Finnish artist Tom of Finland – real name Touko Valio Laaksonen – for the first time,
